intro: Nestlera levynsae, commonly known as the Yucatan moonflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the Yucatán Peninsula in Mexico. It is characterized by its large, white, fragrant flowers that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant has a short, woody stem and produces small, elliptical leaves that are glossy and dark green. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in some areas.
